author: Elizabeth Bennett
comment: If all you ever are is nice, and you expect the world to be nice back, you are in for a world of disappointment. And that disappointment turns to bitterness. And then that bitterness gets a hold of you and you become someone not quite so good.  True virtue is being good and not expecting anything back.   A good man is not a weak man incapable of being bad. A good man is a strong man who chooses to be good anyway.   Find your inner monster. Everyone has one. In weak people,  its not noticeable,  but once they get a bit of power, it is. And they have no idea how to use it.  Harmless people are not good people. They've never been tested.   Find your inner monster and tame it. Stand up for yourself without letting the monster control you.   Be kind out of bravery. Be good because its right. And stand up for yourself.   Show yourself the same kindness you'd show others. Would you let others be treated the way you let yourself be? Would you judge others as harshly as you judge yourself?   Be strong, but don't let people mistreat you. I made that mistake,  and it brought out a very ugly side of me I never knew. I needed to realize I wasn't good. I was just scared to be anything else. I had to learn how to be good all over again once I realized this. I had to quit it with the self pitty and realize I really didn't deserve a reward for goodness if that's what I was doing it for.   I had to acknowledge the ugliness in me(my inner monster) and then face it. I had to learn how to be good because it was right, instead of good because it was all I had. I had to see myself clearly. And in order to do that, I Had to get outside of my head and find other things and people to focus on.   I still struggle with it, but I'm better off then when I was simply trying to be nice and wondering why that wasnt enough, and not knowing how to be anything else.

author: kittyleafdraws
comment: there's a lot of loaded... personal, feelings towards this particular video. Things related to MHA, things related to Izuku, things related to Karma, music in general, and my own mental health... that's why i kept pushing this off even though it kept showing up in my recommended.  I always said that one day I'd want to reclaim those things(The story overall is extremely personal, and I'm aware I'm probably not stealthy in my trying to hide it, I just don't like mentions of it from myself or others). I always said that, but because I'd been avoiding them so viscerally for so so long, I could never find a reason to. I guess this was some kind of a sign, or youtube reading my brain, because I've *been* trying to reclaim some things these past few days, but almost all of it was entirely in my head.  So, when despite several times telling youtube to not recommend this to me because now isn't the time and I don't want to see it, seeing it pop up yet again... I figured, why not?  And honestly? I'm glad I did. It's a good amv. It makes me want to try harder to get back to a place where I'm fully happy again. I want to see MHA and not feel uncomfortable because of personal situations again. So... thanks, for making this, and thanks youtube for stubbornly recommending it to me lol.

comment: JustAnotherGuy thats how most people see it, yeah. But it’s not what it actually is, according to Buddhists

author: JustAnotherGuy
comment: MonsterBros 1 lol I always just saw karma as an action for an action if you do something good you’ll get something good in return if you do something bad you’ll get something bad in return

author: MonsterBros 1
comment: JustAnotherGuy pretty much. I mean, the term ‘karma’ isn’t even what we see it. Karma is the belief that you’ll get reborn into something better the more good you did in your life. Instant karma is when something good happened in your lifetime. So technically, people use the term karma incorrectly, as well😅

author: JustAnotherGuy
comment: MonsterBros 1 yeah it’s easy to put yourself in the eyes of the victim but the truth is everyone gets screwed over even bad people we just consider that justice

author: MonsterBros 1
comment: JustAnotherGuy yeah, it’s because the concept of ‘karma’ is mostly a sense of universal justice. Honestly though, there isn’t such a thing. People might be nice and friendly, but they will always get fucked over - either by people or by circumstance.

author: Paris Player
comment: Just to start with a little context: I love watching edits, sometimes up to twenty a day just on Instagram. So when I say, that this is *art.* I mean it. It’s really good!!! The transitions are tasteful and not too repetitive, and the usage of the *actual song* is pretty accurate. There are so many mediocre edits and AMVs out there that don’t tell the story that is being told by the music, but here it is portrayed very well. The timing is almost spot on, it’s clean, and it’s been put together seamlessly. I honestly say without a doubt, if whoever made this wants to work in the film industry, and you have what it takes- *do it.* There are *no* major films without editors. This person took the scenes and fit the prompt excellently. This isn’t just a hobby, it’s a talent, and I honestly believe this hobby could grow into something, somewhere, for that person.

author: GhostBoy
comment: I don't need my heart anyway. You keep it. This- Izuku reminds me so much of me in a metaphorical sense. Growing up, I wasn't like the other kids. I was made fun of and beat on and I was told I was a freak and that I should jump from the top of the Eiffel Tower. I idolized Markiplier and Jacksepticeye and Crankgameplays. Those three made me believe in the good of the world and made me fight harder. They were my All Might. And because I found reason to fight I made great connections with people and learned that everyone's life sucks. The song really ties in with Midoriyas life in quite a few ways. As it does in mine.

TL:DR: I like to listen to this song when a new episode of bnha comes out so the second it ends I see the new episode.

author: Monty Mole
comment: Am I right in thinking this is based around and Izuku who stays quirkless but wants to be a hero anyway. He still has All Might's support in his actions but didn't get the offer of One for All, and the glitchy parts of the video are him imagining what it would be like if he could do more / he could actually achieve his dreams to the fullest. Despite being in the hero course, this Izuku still feels like the world is against him and it's left him wondering if he should even continue down this path as all it's doing is hurting him physically and mentally.   Or I'm just looking way too into a beautiful, well made AMV! Either way great job and a new subscriber right here!

author: Elizabeth Bennett
comment: If all you ever are is nice, and you expect the world to be nice back, you are in for a world of disappointment. And that disappointment turns to bitterness. And then that bitterness gets a hold of you and you become someone not quite so good.  True virtue is being good and not expecting anything back.   A good man is not a weak man incapable of being bad. A good man is a strong man who chooses to be good anyway.   Find your inner monster. Everyone has one. In weak people,  its not noticeable,  but once they get a bit of power, it is. And they have no idea how to use it.  Harmless people are not good people. They've never been tested.   Find your inner monster and tame it. Stand up for yourself without letting the monster control you.   Be kind out of bravery. Be good because its right. And stand up for yourself.   Show yourself the same kindness you'd show others. Would you let others be treated the way you let yourself be? Would you judge others as harshly as you judge yourself?   Be strong, but don't let people mistreat you. I made that mistake,  and it brought out a very ugly side of me I never knew. I needed to realize I wasn't good. I was just scared to be anything else. I had to learn how to be good all over again once I realized this. I had to quit it with the self pitty and realize I really didn't deserve a reward for goodness if that's what I was doing it for.   I had to acknowledge the ugliness in me(my inner monster) and then face it. I had to learn how to be good because it was right, instead of good because it was all I had. I had to see myself clearly. And in order to do that, I Had to get outside of my head and find other things and people to focus on.   I still struggle with it, but I'm better off then when I was simply trying to be nice and wondering why that wasnt enough, and not knowing how to be anything else.
